Languages.Name: Common
Languages.Description: The most widely spoken language in the world of D&D, Common is the language of humans and many other races.

Languages.Name: Dwarvish
Languages.Description: The language of the dwarves, known for its runic script and harsh, guttural sounds.

Languages.Name: Elvish
Languages.Description: A fluid language with intricate script, spoken by the elves.

Languages.Name: Giant
Languages.Description: The language of giants, featuring a simple script and powerful words.

Languages.Name: Gnomish
Languages.Description: A language with a lot of compound words and technical terms, spoken by gnomes.

Languages.Name: Goblin
Languages.Description: The harsh and guttural language of goblins, hobgoblins, and bugbears.

Languages.Name: Halfling
Languages.Description: A simple and practical language spoken by halflings, with a lot of idioms.

Languages.Name: Orc
Languages.Description: The brutal and straightforward language of orcs, full of harsh consonants.

Languages.Name: Draconic
Languages.Description: An ancient and powerful language spoken by dragons and their kin.

Languages.Name: Infernal
Languages.Description: The language of devils, with a complex and dark script.

Languages.Name: Abyssal
Languages.Description: The chaotic language of demons, featuring harsh and guttural sounds.

Languages.Name: Celestial
Languages.Description: The beautiful and harmonious language of celestial beings.

Languages.Name: Sylvan
Languages.Description: The language of the fey, known for its lyrical and musical quality.

Languages.Name: Undercommon
Languages.Description: A drow language used in the Underdark, with influences from several languages.

Languages.Name: Primordial
Languages.Description: The ancient language of elementals, with several dialects including Auran, Aquan, Ignan, and Terran.
